element.element: Designers and developers

In order to build maintainable, optimized and full featured Flash websites, you only need Silex and whatever software you use to design the background, illustrations, etc. In Silex you can add interactivity and build the structure of your publication. With Flash you will be able to add more complex interactivity and customize components and animation.So where does this fit in the web design workflow ?Flash on it's own doesn't come with the tools for making a website, let alone a web application. So developers often find themselves rewriting the same boiler plate code for deeplinking, generating some html, basic navigation, etc. It's all standard code and Silex allows you to get this out of the way so that you can concentrate on the interesting features that are specific to your website.As you're probably interacting with designers, Silex provides a common ground for communication with them. They can easily manipulate and tweak and skin the site within Silex, and you can concentrate on the functionality.Finally, a market is starting to emerge for third-party addons within the thriving Silex community. The plugin architecture is made so that anyone can design their own components, themes, skins, etc. and integrate them in Silex. The framework is flexible and hookable with either AS3 Flex and Flash, AS1/2, javascript, php and haXe. Package and distribute your plugins on the exchange platform, installation and configuration will be made by the user with Silex toolboxes or with the " manager ".Deveoppers, Silex API is implemented in php5, javascript, ActionScript2 and ActionScript 3 Flash/Flex. And all the classes communicate seamlessly, dispatching events from one language to another. You can use hooks in your plugins, tools and animation layouts, just like for worpress plugins, in order to modify the framework behaviour. As an example, you can see the code of several third party components, freely distributed, such as the Google Analytics plugin, the Piwik plugin, the Yahoo Analytics plugin, the internal search plugin, the snapshot tool, the flip book animation layout... In order to build maintainable, optimized and full featured Flash websites, you only need Silex and whatever software you use to design the background, illustrations, etc. In Silex you can add interactivity and build the structure of your publication. With Flash you will be able to add more complex interactivity and customize components and animation.

So where does this fit in the web design workflow ?

Flash on it's own doesn't come with the tools for making a website, let alone a web application. So developers often find themselves rewriting the same boiler plate code for deeplinking, generating some html, basic navigation, etc. It's all standard code and Silex allows you to get this out of the way so that you can concentrate on the interesting features that are specific to your website.

As you're probably interacting with designers, Silex provides a common ground for communication with them. They can easily manipulate and tweak and skin the site within Silex, and you can concentrate on the functionality.

Finally, a market is starting to emerge for third-party addons within the thriving Silex community. The plugin architecture is made so that anyone can design their own components, themes, skins, etc. and integrate them in Silex. The framework is flexible and hookable with either AS3 Flex and Flash, AS1/2, javascript, php and haXe. Package and distribute your plugins on the exchange platform, installation and configuration will be made by the user with Silex toolboxes or with the " manager ".

Deveoppers, Silex API is implemented in php5, javascript, ActionScript2 and ActionScript 3 Flash/Flex. And all the classes communicate seamlessly, dispatching events from one language to another. You can use hooks in your plugins, tools and animation layouts, just like for worpress plugins, in order to modify the framework behaviour. As an example, you can see the code of several third party components, freely distributed, such as the Google Analytics plugin, the Piwik plugin, the Yahoo Analytics plugin, the internal search plugin, the snapshot tool, the flip book animation layout... Even the WYSIWYG of Silex is a plugin which you can deactivate and which uses the AS3 API.
